item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

You can’t go wrong with the Yamaha blue and white. I have it on 2 of my bikes and I love it. The only better paint job is the Yamaha red and white which I have on 1 for some idiotic demo I did.

There’s a good chance the paint on your tank may warp and bubble if whoever painted it never done it correctly.

Did you say this before or after I pmed you :|[/quote]
I never noticed you pmed me until like 20 seconds ago

@loveandpower - yellow only works if it’s going to be the anniversary paint job that Yamaha used.

@team rocket/ranger squad - i was a semi pro racer and am still sponsored by Yamaha, crashing is simple to do, no matter how talented you are it happens to the best of us.

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

Just phoned the person who told me, he said that trimming is illegal, but so long as you have an inch or more around the L, the police won’t stop you

Read full topic

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

ranger squad:

The bike is broken and so the person took a lot of it apart and then gave me everything, including tonnes of spares. The indicators, however, are not there and so I’m gonna buy some new ones. L-plates need at least an inch in every direction around the L and the previous owner trimmed it perfectly

Got any source for that? The only official documents I’ve came across says it can’t be trimmed, cut at all (barring rounded corners).

Though I’m not really concerned, just curious.

Read full topic

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

The bike is broken and so the person took a lot of it apart and then gave me everything, including tonnes of spares. The indicators, however, are not there and so I’m gonna buy some new ones. L-plates need at least an inch in every direction around the L and the previous owner trimmed it perfectly

Read full topic

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’d suggest getting proper size L plates, police can be real nazis about that kind of stuff. I had my licence plate lifted a little more horizontally than usual but still readable and got pulled over because of it, previously in the day the L plate snapped hence I had to lift it more horizontally in the first place. Meanwhile people I know drive around with extremely illegal plates and have no problems.

Fair warning by the way, contrary to popular belief indicators need to be fitted and working for the bike to pass MOT unless the bike was manufactured without them before a certain date, mid 80’s I believe. One of my rear indicators fell off so I decided to take all indicators off for the MOT following advise I found online that suggested you either need all 4 working indicators or no indicators at all. It was reason #1 why my bike failed MOT. Oddly enough the MOT certificate states “one or all indicators inoperable” where a previous MOT failure was “no indicators fitted”, beats me.

Read full topic

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’m sure you’ll manage, just be careful with rebuilding the engine yourself. Shear off 1 bolt and you’re up shit creek with no paddle, takes fucking hours. When I first started racing/riding I had my dad to do it all, before I got my team together he started working in afghanistan and I had to do more and more myself, it was a bitch whenever I was changing the exhaust system, I’d always shear off a bolt and have to drill it out and helicoil the prick.

Since I’m an official demonstration rider for Yamaha, I’d suggest not actually buying a TZR, they’re arseholes to keep running, extremely unreliable. However, if you’re only 16 and you’re just doing your CBT, I suppose it’ll be better than nothing. An RS50 would’ve been a better choice though ;).

If I was you I would’ve waited until I was 17 and got an R125, such a good bike for a rider just starting to ride on the road. The TZR should last you though.

Also, I think I have Rockstar sponsored r125 fairings lying around somewhere which make it look better than Monster they might still be on my r125 actually, shiet I dunno, I haven’t ridden it in like forever haha.

Read full topic

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @ranger_squad ranger squad
item.description:
@ranger_squad wrote:

£400 ruby, and yeah I know i have to do all that but that shouldn’t take too long, engine is the main bit I guess
Indicators and brake lights aren’t screwed in, we got a bike and then half a bike worth of spares

Read full topic

item.title: My new toy
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

And put a can on the exhaust. Also, your wiring behind the number plate looks to be disconnected, I assume that would be problematic seeing as you’d have no indicators.

When I go up to my garage later, I’ll wheel out my old monster R6 before they pulled out their sponsorship on me lol.

How much did you spend if you don’t mind me asking?
